intro: Harveya lutea, commonly known as the yellow harveya, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. Harveya lutea thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. It is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, where it contributes to the unique biodiversity of the region.
